Class ConfigManager

java.lang.Object
config.ConfigManager
public class ConfigManager extends Object
ConfigManager is responsible for loading and providing access to the configuration settings from a properties file. It provides default values for all supported keys and handles invalid input gracefully.

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    ConfigManager(String path)
    Loads configuration from the specified properties file path.

  • Constructor Details

    • ConfigManager

      public ConfigManager(String path)
      Loads configuration from the specified properties file path.
      Parameters:
      path - the path to the properties file

  • Method Details

    • getLogDirectory

      public String getLogDirectory()
      Returns the configured directory path for log files.
      Returns:
      the log directory path, or the default ("logs") if not set

    • getThreadPoolSize

      public int getThreadPoolSize()
      Returns the configured thread pool size.
      Returns:
      the number of threads to use, or the default (5) if invalid or missing

    • getOutputFile

      public String getOutputFile()
      Returns the configured output file name for the JSON report.
      Returns:
      the file name, or "output.json" if not defined

    • getAnalysisTypes

      public String[] getAnalysisTypes()
      Returns the list of requested analysis types from the configuration.
      Returns:
      an array of analysis type strings

    • getAnomalyLevels

      public Set<String> getAnomalyLevels()
      Returns the log levels to be used for anomaly detection.
      Returns:
      a set of log levels (e.g., "ERROR", "WARNING")

    • getAnomalyWindow

      public int getAnomalyWindow()
      Returns the time window (in seconds) for anomaly detection.
      Returns:
      the time window, or 60 seconds if not defined or invalid

    • getAnomalyThreshold

      public int getAnomalyThreshold()
      Returns the threshold for number of entries to qualify as an anomaly.
      Returns:
      the minimum number of entries, or 5 if not defined or invalid
